intro: Kalbfussia hispidula, commonly known as the hairy kalbfussia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, palmate leaves. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink and white. Kalbfussia hispidula is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks.
